page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT IN BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: How lucky it is that conditions in this area are right for whisky distilling, because this industry plays an important part in the lives of the people by creating employment. About one _third of the bread winners in Ballindalloch work at our two distilleries. Farming is the second most common occupation . Game keepers and fishing ghillies are essential workers, to care for the game on the moors and the fish in the rivers and to help those who come here, often from far away,to shoot and fish. One fairly common occupation is unexpected in this inland area.Several men work in North Sea oil-rigs or in oil-related industries.Their families remain at home while they fly by helicopter between the mainland and the rigs for their spells of duty.
